strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: This used to be a really lively little town.<page>*: But that all changed when the lord of the manor passed away. It was the plague that got him, you know.
<se_def>*: But it hasn't done The Cock and Bull any harm!<page>*: Night and day, all year round, you'll find me here serving the good people of Simpleton all the booze they can hold!
<se_def>*: Woof, woof, er...woof!

<se_high>*: The lord of the manor, who used to run things around here about ten years ago,
was a right nasty piece of work.<page>*: A corrupt, womanising cheat, he was.<page>*: Everyone was glad when he kicked the bucket!

<se_high>*: He left a son behind, mind.
By the name of Angelo.<page>*: It's a crying shame for him, losing his family at such a young age. Now he's condemned to life at the abbey.
<se_high>*: Meow. Me. Ow.
<se_high>*: Hey, do you want to come and work with me? The pay's pretty good.

<se_high>*: Hello! You've come to the right place!
This is a traveller's paradise!
<se_high>*: I'll give you a kiss if you order enough!

<se_low>*: Aaaah! And so ends another glass!
Time for the next round!
<se_low>*: The lord of the manor, who used to rule the roost around here, was a truly bad man. ...Yes. Bad through and through.
<se_low>*: His wife wouldn't give him a child, so he was about to adopt the boy of a young girl he'd had a fling with years earlier, just so as he'd have an heir.
<se_low>*: Of course, then his wife DID have a child <endash> Angelo, they called him <endash> so the first-born was hung out to dry.
<se_low>*: The poor little wretch's own mother had passed away, so he was just packed off to Maella Abbey without so much as a word.<page>*: It's a terrible tale if ever there was one.
<se_high>*: Errr... Purr!

<se_high>*: Hiya! Have a seat.
Anywhere you like.
<se_def>*: I'll put drinks on the table of anyone who's willing to pay. That's the way I do business.
<se_high>*: I hope Angelo doesn't get himself into trouble. The man he's playing against looks like a real bruiser!

<se_high>*: That's it! Come in and have a drink!
Put your feet up and forget about the time.

<se_low>*: I lost to Angelo again today.
Just like yesterday.
And the day before that...
<se_low>*: Humph! Here's to another failure then!
<se_def>*: That Angelo fellow might be a Templar, but he certainly likes his drink and his gambling.

<se_def>*: Not to mention his women!
He's a lowlife, all right.
Ah, I wish I was him!

<se_def>*: So that's a thousand gold coins you've lost now, is it? What happened to my brother,
the gamblin' king, eh?
<se_def>*: I reckon there's somethin' fishy goin' on.

<se_def>*: You ask anyone here. Everyone knows us.
We're the most famous Simpletons there are.
No one messes with us!

<se_def>*: So if you don't wanna get hurt,
you better get outta my sight!
<se_low>*: Argh!
<se_low>*: One more round! Come on! Deal the cards!
<se_def>*: You still got gold to play with, have ya? Come on, then. I'm set.

<se_low>*: Watch it! You don't make fun of me, mate!
I'm not givin' up. Not while I've got cash left to play with. Now deal me in!

<se_def>*: Hah hah! That's the way!
Come on, then. On with the game.
<se_low>*: Cor! Me luck's out today.
<se_high>*: We use this dumb waiter to bring food and drink up from downstairs.
<se_def>*: People think just because I'm from Simpleton, I can't run a successful business. But I'm a decent trader, you know. Wanna buy something?
<se_low>*: I'm only peddling like this because no one's come to the shop for a while.
<se_def>*: Angelo's downstairs gambling again, I think. He's a sinful wretch, that boy!
<se_def>*: Mind you, I don't suppose we can point the finger! We sneaked out of the abbey ourselves. And here we are drinking!

<se_def>*: If Abbot Francisco wasn't protecting him,
that unruly playboy would've been expelled from the abbey long ago.
<se_def>*: Although that said, the contributions the abbey receives from wealthy personages would take quite a hit if Angelo wasn't in the order.
<se_def>*: The rich are very peculiar in the way they seem to like hearing prayers read by pretty-boy monks.
<se_def>*: I don't know! I spend the whole day on my feet touting for customers, only to have that lot lowering the tone in front of the place!<page>*: What's the point!?
<se_def>*: It's enough to make a grown man cry!
<se_high>*: Meow. Meooooooooow.

<se_def>*: Where did that scumbag monk get to!?
He'll wish he'd never been born when I get my hands on him!
<se_def>*: You're one of the ones who was with him, aren't ya!? Come on! Where's that cheatin' runt hidin'!?

<se_def>*: Now you listen to me! I've got a little message for you to pass on when you next see him,
all right?
<se_def>*: You just tell him that the next time he shows his face anywhere near the boss...<page>*: ...he'll finish up at the bottom of a river with more than just cuts and bruises to worry about!

<se_low>*: Grrr...if you hadn't got in the way,
I'd've got my hands around that cocky little monkey's neck!
<se_low>*: I'm gonna introduce that stuck-up little squirt to the business end o' my knife.<page>*: Then he'll know what it's like to be a real holey man! Hur hur hur!
<se_low>*: DUMMY LINE

<se_high>*: All this mess!
It's going to take ages to clear this up!
<se_high>*: At least Angelo got away safely, though.
<se_high>*: Oh, you're <IF_SOLO>one of the ones<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>the ones<ENDIF_SOLO> who helped Angelo before! Tee hee! Thanks!
<se_high>*: Honestly! I'm going to have to ban anyone from the abbey coming in here if this carries on!

<se_low>*: Well it looks like he's done it again!
Angelo's cheating's landed him in deep water for the umpteenth time!

<se_high>*: I thought he'd grow out of it, but his swindling's developed into a bit of a habit,
it seems. He's trouble, that boy!
<se_high>*: Young Angelo <endash> I mean, the lad from the abbey who was here just now <endash> has never been too far away from Simpleton his whole life.
<se_high>*: Everyone in town has known him since he was a little nipper. We're all very fond of him.
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: Ah... Perhaps you could have your next drink with a bit less fuss?
<se_low>*: Hah hah! That was great! A good brawl really gets the ol' blood pumping... So to speak!
<se_high>*: A mop just came up on the dumb waiter from downstairs. What's going on?
<se_def>*: Looks like Angelo just caused another fracas down below. Still can't let go of his secular vices, can he!?

<se_def>*: It's our duty to report him to Captain Marcello...when we've finished our drinks,
of course. Huh huh huh!
<se_def>*: The only thing Angelo's good for is extracting gold from wealthy dignitaries.
<se_def>*: They fall for his boyish good looks every time! A couple of measly prayers, and they can't wait to hand over the money.<page>*: At least the abbey's getting something out of having him.
<se_def>*: Although, I suspect he gets up to more than just prayer reading when he visits those wealthy widows. The boy's a shameless sinner!
<se_high>*: Downstairs is all in a mess, so we've been moved up here.

<se_def>*: Ooooh! What a knock that was!
I took that chair right on the head!

<se_def>*: A fire at the abbey!? You must be joking!
I mean, it's like the Goddess's own home, isn't it?
<se_high>*: There's a funny red glow in the sky up towards the river. It must be a fire.
<se_def>*: Woog!? Wooh!? Woof!
<se_high>*: ...Meow.
<se_low>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...
<se_high>*: Standing about trying to get customers in a little village like this is madness. Who's going to come wandering by here!?
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: Just between you and me, some say that lad Angelo actually came from a rather well-to-do family.
<se_def>*: But some enterprise his parents were involved in went down the drain, leaving them penniless. It can happen to anyone, you see.

<se_def>*: Then his parents went and snuffed it,
and he finished up having to make a nuisance of himself at the abbey. That's what I heard, anyway.
<se_high>*: There's not a single person from the abbey here today. I wonder what's wrong.
<se_high>*: Someone let me out of this dive! Show me a city! I should be dancing on a great big stage under a dazzling spotlight!
<se_def>*: There's not much else to do besides drinking, here in the countryside. I've developed quite a beer belly over the years!
<se_high>*: Meow. Prrrrr.
<se_def>*: The boss lost a fair bit of dough to the gaffer here at cards. But rather than cough up, he's said we'll work off the debt for him!
<se_def>*: Who does he think we are!? His slaves!?

<se_high>*: Hey! I haven't seen you for ages, Angelo!
Come on! Relax and enjoy yourself, okay?
Tee hee!
<se_high>*: Hiya! Come and have a seat anywhere you like!
<se_high>*: Angelo!
<se_high>*: Why haven't you come to see me for so long!? I've been lonely!
<se_high>*: I'm so bored of this place! (Sigh)

<se_high>*: Angelo! Come on in and have a drink!
No need to worry about the bill!
<se_def>Angelo: Hah hah! Thanks!
<se_high>*: So how are things between you and your brother at the abbey?
<se_high>*: You make sure you stay on good terms with him! He's the only family you've got, after all.
<se_def>Angelo: Sound advice, I'm sure. I'll...bear it in mind.
<se_high>*: Do you know that young lad Angelo from the abbey? He's an old customer of mine actually.<page>*: He's had a lot to deal with as he's grown up, you know.
<se_high>*: His father liked to put himself about a bit, you see. And then the poor boy lost both his parents in the plague, leaving him an orphan.
<se_high>*: And just to add insult to injury, he didn't even inherit his parents' mansion or the estate.<page>*: They all had to be sold off to pay back his father's debts.
<se_high>*: No doubt if that useless lord of the manor were still alive today, Angelo would be living a life of luxury in a grand, stately home!

<se_low>*: UrgHIC! I'M no<endash> ...i'm noT drunK.
I'm nOt dur<endash> ...DuRRR<endash> ...dRUNK...aT ALL!
<se_def>*: Ah! Ah-ha-HA! I haVEN't seED, SEem, seeeN you <endash> Hic! <endash> in, ooOOh...mus' be...ooh...AGES!
<se_def>*: Now tHen...hoo<endash> ...woo<endash> ...WHooo'Re You AGain? HIC!

<se_high>*: Angelo, take me somewhere nice!
When I get my next holiday, take me away somewhere really special!
<se_def>Angelo: I'll think about it, baby.
<se_high>*: We use this dumb waiter to bring food and drink up from downstairs.
<se_high>*: Wasn't there some story about Angelo having a half brother in Maella Abbey?

<se_high>*: I hope he wasn't hurt in the fire,
whoever he is.
<se_high>*: Well, well, Angelo! Leaving the abbey to go off travelling, are you!? You take good care of yourself, now!
<se_def>*: Come in, come in! A drink, I presume!? Nothing better to help you forget about your troubles and woes! And your aches and pains.
<se_def>*: So here I am, serving the common man with a drop of the good stuff day and night, all year round! Well, more than a drop, as it goes!
<se_def>*: Awrooooooooooo!

<se_high>*: Looking for a place to stay?
Then why not try The Simpleton's Rest!<page>*: Located a flea's leap from the buzzing centre of town, we offer cosy, unfussy accommodation at a price any pilgrim can afford!<page>*: Stay once and you'll be itching to come again!
<se_high>*: Meoowoow!
<se_low>*: (Burp) Oooh, I've drunk too much... Uuuurgh.
<se_low>*: Hm? Don't I know you? No, maybe not. Or... Oh, never mind!

<se_low>*: Ah! Angelo, my boy! You listen to me.
The hardships you've suffered may just turn out to be your greatest asset. You remember that!

<se_high>*: Make yourself at home!
Have a seat and I'll bring you a drink.
<se_high>*: Where have you been all this time, Angelo!? Now I've got you, I'm not letting you leave here 'til morning! Tee hee hee!
<se_def>*: Ah, come in, come in!
<se_high>*: This tiny little village hasn't got a hint of glitz or glamour. Maybe I should go to Baccarat and get a job as a bunny girl.
<se_high>*: Angelo!

<se_high>*: How could you leave me for so long!?
I've been so lonely!

<se_high>*: Come on in!
There's always plenty of food and drink here!

<se_low>*: Wha's WiTh th' LoNg FaSHe? YOu're puTtin' me off my <endash> Hic! ...offf...myyy...DRINK!
LeAVe me aLOne!
<se_def>*: Ah! Ah-ha-HA! I haVEN't seED, SEem, seeeN you <endash> Hic! <endash> in, ooOOh...mus' be...ooh...AGES!
<se_def>*: Now tHen...hoo<endash> ...woo<endash> ...WHooo'Re You AGain? HIC!

<se_high>*: Business hasn't been so good recently because no one's coming from the abbey any more.
My pay's gone down too.
<se_high>*: Angelo!
<se_high>*: Oh, no. My mistake. I don't know anyone as cold and heartless as you!
<se_def>*: Aaaah! There's nothin' better than sinkin' a glass or two after a hard day's work.
<se_high>*: Hiya! Sit wherever you like, and drink as much as you want!
<se_high>*: Oh, Angelo! You're even more handsome than ever! What's happened?
<se_high>*: I feel like I've seen it and done it all a hundred times before! Even the travellers look the same! I'm so BORED of this place!

<se_high>*: Hey, Angelo!
Why are your feet covered in mud?<page>*: You always used to keep your shoes shiny so you could look up my<endash> Oops! Tee hee hee!
Now you've made me blush!

<se_high>*: Business hasn't been so good recently because no one's coming from the abbey any more.
My pay's gone down too.
<se_high>*: (Sniff, sniff)
<se_high>*: Well at least I can't smell any perfume on you! But there is a funny smell of SOMETHING on you.

<se_def>*: Come in, come in! ...Well!
You certainly look like you're in the mood!
<se_def>*: There's nothing better than a drink to celebrate any occasion, and every occasion!<page>*: And I'm here all year round to attend to your liquid needs!
<se_high>*: Not long now! Hee hee hee! I can hardly wait!

<se_high>*: I simply HAVE to go to the bazaar in Argonia! Even if it means divorce!
I've got shopping to do!
<se_low>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...
<se_high>*: The abbey Templars come here drinking all the time now, but they're vulgar louts, every one of them!
<se_high>*: I'd much rather be outside trying to get the customers in, than inside having to make conversation with them!
<se_high>*: Just when I think I've got you out of my mind, you go and show up again! You can't keep doing this to me, Angelo!
<se_high>*: Come in, come in! Things are rather unsettled at the moment, but you can count on one thing.<page>*: I'll be here serving drinks to take your mind off it all!
<se_high>*: Hey, hey, hey! Give me some warning if you're planning on paying a visit! I'd have put more make-up on if I'd known!
<se_def>*: Have a seat wherever you like.

<se_low>*: UrgHIC! I'M no<endash> ...i'm noT drunK.
I'm nOt dur<endash> ...DuRRR<endash> ...dRUNK...aT ALL!
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... HIC! ...Ah-phew...

<se_def>*: The boss hasn't come back for me,
so I guess I'll just have to stay here.

<se_def>*: It doesn't matter if you drink or not.
Just whether you're any good in battle.
<se_def>*: If you've got talent for that, you're in. That's what Abbot Marcello says. And once you're in, you can get away with blue murder!

<se_high>*: That monk looks like he's at a funeral.
Even when he's drinking.
<se_high>*: Has something happened?

<se_high>*: Look! Look, Angelo!
I changed my hair while you were away!
<se_high>*: I moved my parting to the left a bit, and I cut my fringe back a little, and<endash>

<se_high>*: ...Oh, forget it! You're too late!
I'm tired of trying to impress you!

<se_def>*: If I didn't...drink, I'd be...SOBER!? Hic!
Tha's not really my....my...thing.
<se_def>*: You listen to me, Angelo... YOU...are a smart MAN! Yes? ...Yes! You were RIGHT to leave th' abbey...
<se_def>*: Me? I don't... I mean, I'm...

<se_def>*: Grrr! I HATE lookin' at those Tep<endash> ...those Ten<endash> ...those TEMPlars! You, right... YOU!
Are ALL RIGHT! Yes you are.<page>*: But THEY... THEY!? THEY are HOOLIGALIGANS! Tell 'em to get <endash> Hic! <endash> lost.
<se_def>*: Boss! Boss! Don't let 'em win, boss!
<se_def>*: I can't believe it! The boss is s'posed to be a famous muscle-man 'round these parts!
<se_low>*: Oooh! That bleedin' monk and that overweight bumpkin...!
<se_high>*: That hooligan is out looking for my Angelo!
<se_high>*: So now the men are chasing after him too!
<se_high>*: You can still see the remains of the old abbey if you leave Simpleton here and head off in the direction of the hills.

<se_high>*: The building was sealed up after all the monks who lived there died in a plague.
That was all a very long time ago now, though.
<se_high>*: That's how the new abbey came to be built on the little island in the middle of the river, apparently.

<se_low>*: If you head east along the river-bank,
there's a very strange place.

<se_low>*: You'll find an odd stone on top of a ruin.
There's an emblem engraved in it.
I don't know what it's all about.
<se_low>*: Hic!

<se_low>*: Drink... Drink is...GOOD. Travellin's pretty good too... But drink's REALLY good.
Reaally, rEAlly, reaLLy...really? Yes It IS!

<se_high>*: I hate all these drunkards!
But you're nice. I like you!
<se_def>*: You must steer clear of the old abbey ruin to the east of here.

<se_def>*: There's a ghost there!
The ghost of a monk who died in the plague!
<se_def>*: I came across a stone once with the same engraving as we Templars have on our rings.
<se_def>*: I don't know why, but I just thought I'd see if my ring fitted into the impression in the stone, and<endash><page>*: Well! You wouldn't believe what happened!
<se_high>*: Hello! So? Do you like Simpleton?
<se_def>*: I've still got a bump on my head from where that chair hit me. You know, in the brawl we had here before.
<se_def>*: Oooh, it really hurts!
<se_def>*: Eh? You're...
<se_def>*: No, you can't be!<page>*: I thought you were the ones who cheated the boss before, but no one would be stupid enough to talk to someone they'd had a fight with.
<se_low>*: The lord of the manor who used to rule the roost around here was a truly bad man. ...Yes. Bad through and through.
<se_low>*: His wife wouldn't give him a child, so he was about to adopt the boy of a young girl he'd had a fling with years earlier, just so as he'd have an heir.
<se_low>*: Of course, then his wife DID have a child <endash> Angelo, they called him <endash> so the first-born was hung out to dry.
<se_low>*: The poor little wretch's own mother had passed away, so he was just packed off to Maella Abbey without so much as a word.<page>*: It's a terrible tale if ever there was one.

<se_low>*: Ah! Angelo, my boy! You listen to me.
The hardships you've suffered may just turn out to be your greatest asset. You remember that!

<se_def>*: Come in, come in! Rest your feet, weary <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>! Huh huh! While you have a drink,
of course!

<se_def>*: Morning, noon and night, all year round,
you can rely on me to serve you!
<se_def>*: Come in, come in! Have yourself a smooth drink for the end of the world! It's the final fling sale!
<se_def>*: (Whine)
<se_def>*: I came to comfort the hearts of those troubled by monsters and the menacing red sky.
<se_def>*: But everything on the menu's half price today! There's no time for comforting!

<se_high>*: I don't much care if the sky's red OR blue.
But I have to say, I'm not very fond of monsters.
<se_low>*: It's great, isn't it!? Booze is cheap when the sky's red! MY final fling's going to cost me an arm and a leg! But who cares!?
<se_low>*: Oh! Don't start talking to me without giving me any warning! I nearly spilt my drink! Hic!

<se_high>*: Even with the world about to end,
I'm still here trying to get more customers!
Oh, what's the point!?
<se_high>*: Meow. Meow!

<se_def>*: Oops! I'm cleaning up here.
Mind your step.
<se_high>*: Hiya! Welcome to the proprietor's desperate final fling sale! ♪

<se_high>*: You promised me Angelo! You said that
if the world were to end tomorrow,
you'd spend your last day with me!
SO WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN!?
<se_def>*: Come in, come in! Everything on the menu's half price at the moment.
<se_def>*: We're all doomed! Everyone'll be killed! Monsters will come down from that castle in the sky and devour us all! Hic!
<se_def>*: 'S a LOTta peopLE in 'Ere T'DAY! ...'s'nice! MaKes forra <endash> Hic! <endash> a GOod atom<endash> ..ashtom<endash> ...ATMOSphere!

<se_low>*: HEY! Y-Young'un! SIDDOWN!
Have A LiTtle DRinky-WInKy with mE...
<se_def>*: Ah-phew, phew, phew, phew, pheeeeew.
<se_high>*: They're all saying they saw a strange castle up in the sky!

<se_high>*: I don't care how cheap the drink is,
they've had too much!
<se_high>*: Hiyaya! I'm not drun..? Dru...? Drunk!
<se_def>*: People think just because I'm from Simpleton, I can't run a successful business. But I'm a decent trader, you know. Want to buy something?
<se_low>*: I'm only peddling like this because no one's come to the shop for a while.
<se_def>*: Alchemy's a really useful skill.<page>*: You can bung a load of commonplace items into a pot and make some really unusual things that you won't find in any shop.

<se_def>*: Take strong medicine, for example.
You can make it from really cheap ingredients,
but sell it for a small fortune.<page>*: That's something worth remembering.
<se_def>*: Although you can have too much of a good thing. Sell too much of a rarity and the price'll drop because it's not rare any more!<page>*: Moderation's the name of the game.
